intro: Erythrophysa transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers have five distinct petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
